• Actively integrating BDLS (a Byzantine Fault Tolerant consensus) protocol to Hyperledger Fabric (having 14K+ commits) enhancing the reliability and security of Fabric’s ordering service in partial synchronous networks.
  • Implemented Orderer interfaces in Fabric for BDLS and configured message communications using Go, gRPC and protobuf among nodes of Fabric's distributed ordering service.
  • Collaborating with experienced senior software engineers in different time zones to enhance the security and reliability of Fabric's ordering service.

• I am currently working as a Software Developer at the Frugal Innovation Lab at Santa Clara University where I am leading two projects here, GoodBuys and Rose Academies.
  • 1. GoodBuys: Engineering a solution, aimed at enabling consumers to find ethically produced goods, thereby promoting sustainable consumption and production.
  • Developed REST APIs, web scrapers and mobile application for finding ecolabels for different brands.
  • 2. Rose Academies: Designing a user-friendly mobile app to provide healthcare resources for differently-abled individuals, utilizing Flutter, Firebase, and Google Cloud Functions.

• Engineered the first real-time web application for vehicular traffic visualization using GPS data helping identify back-of-queue traffic incidents and save client monitoring infrastructure.
  • Developed REST APIs in Java to process GPS points from a Kafka feed and render 1M+ vehicles on a map in realtime.
  • Scaled the application with AWS ElastiCache and multithreading, enhancing read/write speed and reducing delay.
  • Engineered the ‘Playback’ feature using AWS S3 and APIs empowering users to analyze and visualize historical traffic data.
  • Created CICD workflow using GitHub Actions, AWS ECS, and EKS reducing deployment time.

• Designed messaging solutions using Azure Logic Apps and Service Bus to streamline real-time messaging system for a UK-based retailer. Implemented message transformation and enrichment using Azure Functions and Java.
  • Developed a new Kafka integration pattern using IBM App Connect Enterprise to streamline 15+ legacy consumer flows, saving $65K.
  • Reduced integration job deployment time by 40% using custom Ansible modules, optimizing the CICD pipeline and saving engineering efforts.
  • Implemented a secure file transfer solution with SFTP and Azure VM for efficient file transfers, replacing legacy MQFTE solution, saving licensing and support fees.
